title: out going email

creator: dasmit

title: Transfering messages physically between computers
content:
I have a Thunderbird on my laptop with a big folder in the Local Folder. It has a labeled "mail window" having 5,044 messages in a folder named under the internals of the Profile as "Family" and "Family.msf". Under "Family" are at the next level called "Archive-A" and "Archive-A.msf". (This may not be a kosher "archive".) I tried to use NanaZip to prepare as a zip by Exporting it the other laptop's Thunderbird in our house, but the process seemed to hang before that could do it. Maybe there had to be two levels, I dunno. Maybe getting from a .ZIP to a .SBD....

Even if that had resulted in a useful .ZIP, I'm not at all clear how I could I succeed in importing it into the main profile on the other TB computer. I am defeated at this point.

I wish I had a "Thunderbird for Dummies", or at least a manual + a lexicon with acronyms.

Could someone help me out?

Thanks!


~Steve
creator: oudeheis

title: Deleting an attachment does not delete attachment (just makes a copy without attachment)
content:
Dear Sir or Madame,

I posted this issue already earlier (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1428881?utm_campaign=questions-reply&utm_source=notification&utm_medium=email#answer-1613810), but it still persists.

Zited from my earlier report: The usual process that happened when deleting or separating attachments from e-mails was that a copy of the email without the attachment was produced by Thunderbird and the original email was deleted.

This is not longer working. When I delete an attachment, the original email containing the attachment is not deleted. So I have two versions of the email in my postbox, one with the attachment, the other without.

Probably I'm missing a setting?

Thunderbird version 115.3.3 (32-Bit)

Still happening with 115.12.2 (32-Bit)

Sincerely yours, Markus Piotrowski
creator: Markus.Piotrowski

title: adjuntos
content: Hola, nuestra empresa es nueva usuaria de Thunderbird. Anteriormente estábamos usando Microsoft Outlook. Una de las mayores diferencia que encuentro en el correo, es el tratamiento de los datos adjuntos. En Outlook si hacías un click en el adjunto podías ver una previsualización sin tener que abrirlo o guardarlo. En thunderbird, creo que solamente puedes o guardarlo o abrirlo, por lo que abre un nuevo programa. Yo en muchos casos sólo quiero previsualizarlos para decidir que hago con ellos. No necesito abrirlos. ¿Es posible tener esta opción? Gracias Hello, our company is a new Thunderbird user. We were previously using Microsoft Outlook. One of the biggest differences I find in the email is the way attachments are handled. In Outlook if you clicked on the attachment you could see a preview without having to open or save it. In thunderbird, I think you can only either save it or open it, so it opens a new program. I in many cases just want to preview them to decide what to do with them. I don't need to open them. Is it possible to have this option? Thanks
creator: j.rodriguez18782

title: Sent mails no longer saved in "Sent" folder
content:
I've been happily using Thunderbird for a long time and now have version 115.12.2 (64-bit) on my MacBook Pro. It's old (10.14.6) but it's all I need. Until yesterday, TB worked fine. Suddenly, business emails stopped saving to my "Sent" Folder. I deleted a number of old emails and compacted the folder but that has not helped. I don't have the problem with other TB accounts. I checked the account settings: 

               Place a copy in "Sent" Folder on (my account) – as it always was.

I also checked "Show confirmation dialog when messages are saved". Despite seeing that, the message is NOT saved.

Are my sent mails from the last 24 hours saved anywhere? If so, how can I retrieve them?. How can I make sure they are saved in my "Sent" folder? Thanks so much!
creator: Nellie15

title: IMAP ok but SMTP fails on Windows 11
content:
Hello,

I have been using Thunderbird for many years without any issues. I recently bought a laptop running Windows 11. On this machine, I have two accounts that cannot send emails via SMTP. What is puzzling is that I can retrieve emails through IMAP without any problems.

For another account I had to use STARTTLS to get it working. But on my Windows 10 machine, the same account is sending emails correctly with SSL/TLS.

Thunderbird is allowed through the Windows firewall and is on the antivirus whitelist.

I recently fixed an issue (connecting to Gmail) by allowing cookies, so it might be a simple fix like that.

Could someone help me, please?

Many thanks!
creator: Plortus

creator: nkenyon8

title: SMTP suddenly stopped working
content:
Hello,

So - SMTP suddenly stopped working in our whole company. We are using Gmail accounts configured with Thunderbird for a few years already. It's all been working until an hour ago.

Tried deleting and adding accounts, changing authentification to google app passwords etc.\

SMTP servers do have different descriptions.

Just configured an account in outlook and it works out of the box, so I'm guessing it's got something to do with Thunderbird settings, but we didn't change anything, and especially that we have 8 PCs and it stopped working on every one of it.

The error I get when trying to send a message is:

"Sending message failed. The message failed to send because it failed to connect to the outgoing mail (SMTP) server "smtp.gmail.com". The server may be unreachable or not accepting SMTP connections. Please verify that your outgoing mail server settings are correct and then try again or contact your server administrator."

(translated from polish).

Best regards.
creator: mateusz10

title: Thunderbird deletes all my messages in trash folder despite it isn't allowed!
content:
Hi!

I realised that Thunderbird keeps deleting my messages in every account from the trash folder. I didn't change any of the settings and I checked them again - as you can see in the screenshot, the settings say to not delete messages in the trash. It's a catastrophe, because I've lost messages that I had to check again.

-> Is there any way to restore messages that Thunderbird deleted without my permission? -> Is there any way to make sure that Thunderbird does not delete messages any more?


Thank you!

Version: 115.3.1 on a Mac
creator: meinewegwerfadresse
